title: New space company seeks to solve orbital mobility with high delta-v spacecraft
summary: "If we’re going to have a true space economy, that means logistics and supply services."

title: Portal Space Systems unveils plans for highly maneuverable spacecraft
summary: Startup Portal Space Systems, founded by a former SpaceX and Amazon executive, has unveiled plans for spacecraft that use a novel propulsion technology designed to enable rapid movement between orbits.

title: Orbital congestion reaching critical levels, warns new report
summary: Slingshot Aerospace publishes its first “State of Satellite Deployments & Orbital Operations"

title: China’s Shenzhou-17 crew return to Earth
summary: China’s Shenzhou-17 crew returned to Earth Tuesday following six months aboard the Tiangong space station.

title: Airbus outlines plans for future high-resolution imaging satellites
summary: More than a year after losing two Pléiades Neo high-resolution imaging satellites in a launch failure, Airbus has outlined plans to replace them.

title: China selects new space missions including lunar far side astronomy and terrestrial exoplanet survey
summary: The Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) is backing a new suite of diverse, cutting edge missions, advancing its ambitious agenda in space science.

title: SES to acquire Intelsat for $3.1 billion
summary: SES is acquiring rival satellite operator Intelsat for $3.1 billion, a deal that would bring together two of the major GEO satellite operators in a market facing increased competition from LEO constellations.

title: FAA Learning Period to Get Another Extension
summary: House and Senate committee leaders announced just after midnight that they have reached agreement on a new FAA reauthorization bill. The vast majority of the bill does not deal with […]

title: Launch Roundup: China returns to the moon, SpaceX keeps up high launch cadence
summary: This week, China returns to the Moon with the Chang’e-6 mission, making the first-ever attempt to collect samples from a site on the far side, near the lunar South Pole.

title: Kuva Space wins ESA hyperspectral contract
summary: Kuva Space will develop onboard hyperspectral data processing and communications links to help Finnish government agencies focused on border security, wildfires and landslides.
